page.title: 19 GENERAL DESCRIPTION.
page.content: This is a{coastal area.}Higher land slopes gently down to sandy beaches and the sea.There are not many trees only small bushes on the clifftops. Many small cottages line the coast road with modern bungalows and houses more inland. There is a{granite causeway leading to{Lihou Island}to which you can walk at low tide. It is a tourist area with hotels, restaurants and small cafes. It also has a{Maritime Museum. Fishing boats are often seen in the bays, alongside windsurfers. To the west, the cliffs are high and rugged, sheltering{Portelet harbour from the north west gales.Rocquaine Bay slopes to the north.
